page.title: 01The River Hems Valley
page.content: The area covered by our survey is notable for its very rural character. There is no village in it, though it is surrounded by villages and as a result the amenities are notable for their absence. At first sight the land appeared to be all farm land but on further investigation we found that several former farms had changed in recent years under the pressure on agriculture and are now thriving small businesses in tourism,crafts or local trade and service. This is an area of rolling hills and streams with narrow lanes and high hedges making a confusing pattern for the unwary visitor who could be forgiven for thinking that civilisation is miles away whereas the area is very close to Torbay, Totnes and Newton Abbot.
